results.headline: Review: ‘The Sense of an Ending,’ and the Elusiveness of Truth
results.summary_short: Adapted from Julian Barnes’s 2011 novel, Ritesh Batra’s film portrays an emotionally detached man gingerly revisiting his past.

results.headline: Review: ‘Kong: Skull Island’ Crosses a 1933 Classic With ‘Apocalypse Now’
results.summary_short: In this remake, the beast King Kong has a new look and a new beauty (Brie Larson), who’s feistier than her predecessors.

results.headline: Review: Seduced by Youth in ‘Suntan,’ and Refusing to Let Go
results.summary_short: Winter gives way to summer, and a Greek island offers a middle-aged doctor an opportunity for hedonistic adventure.

results.headline: Review: ‘Uncertain,’ a One-of-a-Kind Texas Town on the Brink

results.headline: Review: ‘My Scientology Movie,’ an Offbeat Inquiry

results.headline: Review: ‘Beauty and the Beast’ Revels in Joy and Enchantment

results.headline: Review: Sandra Oh and Anne Heche in One Ferocious ‘Catfight’

results.headline: Review: Shirley MacLaine Wants ‘The Last Word’? She Should Have It

results.headline: Review: A Father Dies, and Duty Weighs on a Son in ‘Nakom’

results.headline: Review: At ‘Table 19,’ Random Wedding Guests Straining to Laugh

results.headline: Review: In ‘Logan,’ a Comic-Book Stalwart Turns Noirish Western
